Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here at the Silver Palms and loved it!! Everyone is so friendly and helpful. Staff was exceptional...hope to stay there again sometime soon. Within walking distance to many attractions. Great value, great price!! Would recommend to anyone.....we loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: MDI1
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel surpassed our expectations. Great room with super comfortable bed and pillows. Friendly helpful staff went out of their way to make sure that we enjoyed a relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “:-)”
Reviews.Author: dagler1969
Reviews.Content: The hotel was three months old, clean, very stylish, had free wifi, carparking, and breakfast included. Walking distance to Duval Street, the beach, Mallory Square, and Ernest Hemingway's house.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations!!”
Reviews.Author: Dig12
Reviews.Content: One of the best place to stay with family. Exceptional Service and staff was very helpful. The location is very quiet, peaceful and secure. The hotel and rooms were clean and comfortable. The island is pretty small so any place you go in Key West you would hear the plane noise once in a while. Would definitely stay next time n recommend to friends n family.

Reviews.Title: “would Stay again and again!”
Reviews.Author: Blues1231
Reviews.Content: This place used to be the old El Rancho Motel before the owners demolished and rebuilt it from the ground up. I used to stay here each year my family and I visited, then again when I was on Spring break in College. Love Key West, Love the people even more, and this NEW hotel makes Key West even better! Im excited that see the owners finally have it up and running, which means the service will only get better as time goes on! A definite stay! close to the center of town, and easy walks to all part of Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Brand New Hotel!! 1 Mile to Mallory Sq.”
Reviews.Author: AnnArbor50
Reviews.Content: Recently built (3 mos). Located on Truman - 2 blocks from Duval in a quiet area. Rooms are modern w/ balcony--exceptionally clean and well appointed with flat screen, cozy bedding, & refrig. Pool, free parking and breakfast are a plus. Front desk employee exceptionally friendly and helpful. Conveniently located--one mile walk down Duval to Mallory Square. Room prices were less than brand name Key West hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Beach-Style hotel and a relief from finding parking in KW!”
Reviews.Author: Mezra10
Reviews.Content: We slept so comfortably and loved the clearly brand new rooms with their white wash beach style shutters and crisp style. Everything was very clean and the service was so wonderful, it has been years since I stayed somewhere where everyone I met on the staff went above and beyond to make us comfortable and to be nice. This was the hotel with the best rate that we could find in Key West, including hotels much further from the downtown area. We were able to leave our car parked at the hotel (and we felt very safe leaving it there), so it was a real relief as far as parking was concerned, because it is very expensive and a real pain to park around key west. The area seemed very safe. Thank you Silver Palm staff!

Reviews.Title: “New and Beautiful Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Hudnett
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff and the perfect location that is within walking distance to Duval Street. Sincerely, Rick Hudnett https://sites.google.com/site/rickhudnett/

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business or pleasure!!!”
Reviews.Author: luckey133
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel on a quick business trip to Key West. The rooms were spacious, modern, and clean. The internet was fast. The staff was professional. I travel frequently and this place certainly exceeded most accomodations I have seen. Unfortunately, I didn't get much time to enjoy on Duval Street, but this hotel is located just a few blocks away. I plan on staying here next time I vacation in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “So-So, Clean, but Not Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: princsoreo
Reviews.Content: My stay here was just fine, but nothing fantastic. Let me break it down: The good: The room was nice, new and clean with plenty of space and a bed that was just fine with contemporary, clean linens and pretty colors. Check in and check out was extremely fast, efficient and friendly. There is a $100 security deposit when you check in, but this wasn't a big deal for us. The not so good: - The hotel's location: if you choose a "streetview balcony" prepare to overlook a dingy laundromat or some tiny, crappy houses. It's an easy walk to Duval, but still a walk, so if being within steps of the action is a concern for you, this may not be the best place. The bf and I are in good shape and we don't mind walking, so this was fine for us, but we both said we would have preferred being a tad bit closer. I like to wear high heels, and the extra few steps made me think twice about it. - Outdoor corridors: this hotel had them, which isn't my favorite. - Creative photography: this is much smaller than the photos online, particularly the pool area, as others have noted. A $10 resort fee really isn't a big deal to me, but if you are someone who is concerned about this, there really isn't anything warranting it at this hotel. Definitely not a resort, more of a Best Western. - Thin walls. We could hear the maids walking by every morning, cleaning the adjoining rooms (yes, our room had a door to another room attached, which I kind of hate), and we could hear general street noise. This probably isn't the place for light sleepers. - There is no exhaust fan in the bathroom and ours definitely had a gross, light mildew odor going on. - This is a "green" hotel, meaning you have to put your room key in a slot near the door to make the power in the room work. I hate to say this, but this is one example where I think "green" really means "hotel trying to save money on the electric bill." In all, this hotel was just fine, and while I probably wouldn't stay here again, I might if the price was right. To reiterate: it was clean, the rooms were spacious and the location was pretty good. The bf and I usually try to stay in four-star places when we go out of town, though, and this was just more of a true three-star, on par with a basic Holiday Inn or Best Western. So, if you're just looking for a place to sleep, this is a fine choice. If you're looking to enjoy some upscale amenities, this probably isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new and convienient to everything!”
Reviews.Author: jxs324
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silver Palms Inn and could not have been more pleased. Not only is the hotel brand new, but it is convenient in the fact that everything is within walking distance making it easy to explore famous Key West. The hotel is only a few blocks from the beach too. We truly enjoyed our stay and WILL be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Fraudulous Employee and transaction”
Reviews.Author: Dutox
Reviews.Content: We made 2 days reservation (one in a standar room and one in the suite )in this hotel we did the check out normaly, nothing to declare everything was ok for us and the hotel , like in every hotels all over the world .And when we did arrived in france we checked on our bank account and the hotel charged us 150 dollars extra because 2 robes were missing into our room(robes that we were not aware to had in the room...). The hotel never contacted us or send email to inform us that we are going to be charged for that, so i decided to contact them and the staff told us that after we left the room and did the check out those two articles were missing and the housekeeping did the check list and didnt find the 2 robes . Barth the manager told us on the phone that we are liars and robbers. We tried to defend ourself explaining that we were even not aware that this articles were available in our room. And he answered to us "it s like this ,nothing can change" and hung up .They treated us like bad person. We went to police in france to complain and to bank to fill the Visa form for fraud. we sent several mails one week ago to complain directly to the owner of this hotel , but we still have no answer .... Very very disappointing...

Reviews.Title: “SILVER PALMS INN - MOTEL OR RESORT? YOU DECIDE....”
Reviews.Author: MichelinReviewer
Reviews.Content: We traveled south to visit this new motel in Key West. We had high hopes, but as soon as we "checked in" ,we decided to review this place from top to bottom. The less- than-friendly desk clerk was not enthusiastic and seemed to "care less' whether we were there or not. He was more concerned with getting us to sign that we were responsible if we "broke" something and that we agreed to a daily "resort fee." When we asked why we would be charged a "resort fee", we were told it was for use of the pool. Well, our Michelin Travel Dctionary defines a "resort" as something more than this motel on stilts with a pool in the middle of the parking lot. The last time we checked, a "resort" has a beach, golf and tennis courses, spa, and many other amenities--not to mention beautiful views. The front view of this "resort" is the busy and noisy Truman Avenue and the back of this "resort" looks to be a prime spot for a trailer park. It a basic motel on stilts that has been made "Key Westy" with a tin roof and blue canvas window canapies. It was also "slim pickins" at breakfast. Toast, bagels, and some cereal about sums it up--and orange juice in some "mouth wash" size plastic cups. There was some fresh fruit---over ripe black bananas and a couple of apples. On the good side, the beds were comfortable and the linens were crisp and new. The soap and shampoo are packaged to look like "boutique" products when actually they are cheap knock-offs made in China. We give this place a "average" when compared to everything else in Key West, and a well "below average" to the seasoned traveler who knows the difference between a resort and a motel on stilts with a staff in Hawaiian shirts.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty rooms-noisy street”
Reviews.Author: milosmomma
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in January. The room was very pretty with nice colors and furnishings. Bathroom had all the necessities. Walking distance to Duval Street. But this hotel is on Truman Avenue which we didn't know us a very busy street. Our room was on first floor at Truman and Margaret Streets. The laundry across the street was open for deliveries all night and very loud. I suggest earplugs and a dose of Nyquil to get through it. There wasn't much hot water throughout the visit. The front desk was awesome and breakfast very good. Overall it was a good value, nice location, nice rooms... Go to the Flaming Buoy restaurant two blocks on Packer and Margaret. Lobster mac n cheese is amazing!!! I'd go back here but would request a room NOT on that busy corner.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic New Hotel, Great People, Owners, Service, BFast,etc.,etc.”
Reviews.Author: Irish997
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Mid January and what a trip. All amenities are just as they look on the website. Service was excellent, owners were on site and great people. We made a few friends that were great people. We would definitely go again. Nice job.

Reviews.Title: “i will at only silver palms inn whenever i go to keywest”
Reviews.Author: soniun1161
Reviews.Content: nicest hotel for right price,clean,nice pool,nice breakfast,friendly enviorment,great location close to downtown,walking distance.i will tell all my friends about it.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Bijal82
Reviews.Content: excelent roomservice,room sizeand furniture, view, location,well come desk service,customer service

Reviews.Title: “absolutely horrendous”
Reviews.Author: jolandavanDijk
Reviews.Content: Never ever stay here! Totally overrated and no services. Breakfast is only until 0930 hrs ( new year's day), you cannot call europe, there is no room service, breakfast is ridiculous, you cannot smoke on the balcony, etc. etc. We have travelled all over the world but this is the worst hotel that we stayed in and/or experienced! We paid USD 369 for absolutely nothing! Unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “5 star”
Reviews.Author: srobbin
Reviews.Content: Spacious room. Great location. Friendly staff. Bring ear plugs no matter where you stay. Roosters all over, crow from 2 A.M. - 9 A.M.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Overlaid
Reviews.Content: I can't find any issues with the hotel itself. New, sparkling clean, lots of free parking, great staff. I was on the first floor facing the pool and Margaret Street. The only drawback to that was four roosters vying to see who was the loudest at 5:30AM right outside my room. This isn't in the usual part of town I stay, but it made my trip more of an adventure. An easy walk to Duval Street, I also walked through the Key West Cemetery, to Mallory Square, Fort Zachary and the Southernmost Point. Easy all the way.

Reviews.Title: “nice...only one problem....”
Reviews.Author: TamaraAlexandria
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new and clean. The rooms are large, except the bathroom door blocks the sink area which is awkward. A design flaw. The bed and bedding iare great. The breakfast is disappointing, cold danish, cereal and coffee...we didn't bother, we went out for breakfast. The location was several blocks from the real action on Duvall Street, but walkable. The main problem I have with the hotel is that they debit your credit card for $100.00 deposit and it stays on your credit card in a pending status for almost a week. As I write this review, the charge is still pending and I checked out 5 days ago. I find this irrating.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: sandusree
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for just 1 day and we enjoyed our stay. This place is in the heart of key west and close-by to duval street ( a happening street with great street food). We rented bicycle to go around the place. This hotel is newly constructed and so it is well maintained. The room was very clean and the bed was super comfortable. The bathrooms were awesome..It also had a cute little balcony which faced the road (narrow old european style). The hotel has fresh paint. They also served free breakfast..The swimming pool was superb! The front desk guy was very kind and very inviting. All in all, 5 stars ! Only con is - the price.. i wish it was a little cheaper...we paid 179 $ (incl tax) for a king room.. thumbs up if you found my review helpful !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: danzbach
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at The Silver Palms for 3 nights. We loved every aspect of it..the price, the cleanliness, the individualized service from the pple at the front desk, our room, and the heated pool. After reading many of the reviews, I am shocked that many ppl complain about the location. We actually enjoyed walking around the island from our hotel. One night we even rented bikes, which was suggested by the front desk. My friend and I were there for a wedding which was at the Casa Marina. All of our friends ended up staying at the Casa Marina, which is very costly for being a "resort." Silver Palms was definately more affordable and our room was more spacious and decorated more appropriately for an island get-a-way. Many of our friends actually regretted not staying at the Silver Palms because of the heated pool, the free breakfast, and the size of the rooms. The breakfast isn't your typical continenta breakfast but its suitable for getting you through until lunch. The only negative about this hotel is the outside noise. Our room faced a neighboorhood off of Truman and every morning between 5-7 we had roosters crowing beneath our balcony. We thought it was rather humerous. We liked waking up early in order to take advantage of the day. At night, we looked foward to going back to our room because our bed was extremely comfortable. I hadn't slept that well in a while. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Keys. If you're expecting to stay at a world-class resort..then don't expect to find anything like that in Key West. Silver Palms is definately the place to stay if you're looking for a clean hotel with exceptional service!

Reviews.Title: “Location not as close as it seems”
Reviews.Author: RoninWalter
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in November. Our room faced Truman ave and it was noisy at night and in the morning so be aware of that. We thought we could walk to Duval St each evening but most of the good nightlife is farther down Duval so it's quite a walk. We started cabbing it on day two. Cab to Mallory square was about $7-$8 depending on the driver. The pool heater was broken our entire stay. I tried to get in one afternoon but could not bear the cold! The elevator was being repaired outside our room and the gentleman repairing it talked ALL DAY and it was all we could hear from our room for hours on end (I unfortunately was not feeling well and had to spend some of one day in our room). I went to lay by the pool hoping for quiet as nobody else was there... but alas the repair man just would not stop talking. His coworker could not get a word in. It echoed all over the pool area and down the halls as it is an open air set up. The water pressure in the shower was bad but we were with other people staying in another hotel that had the same experience and I think it's just the way it is in Key West. The hotel felt like a motor inn on the outside but the rooms were nicely decorated and contemporary. The $250 deposit was a surprise at check in and throughout our stay we saw many surprised people checking in experiencing the same thing. The free breakfast was the worst I have ever had in a hotel and we only ate it once, and I can pretty much eat anything. It was a carb fest and the offerings were bland and tasteless except for a small plate of croissants. Some hard boiled eggs or some kind of protein would have been nice. I thought it was a good value for the money but would consider staying a little closer to the lower end of Duval for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive Rooms, but no Key West charm or warmth!”
Reviews.Author: mikesluckywife
Reviews.Content: Tried the Silver Palms because it was new and got great reviews - Paid $179 for a king room which I thought was pricey for the off season, but was willing to give it a try. While we were checking-in a couple who walked in off the street with a coupon torn out of some booklet, was quoted $129 for a room with 2 queens (same room that was $169 when I booked my room online). When we questioned why a walk-up got a better rate than someone who booked online, ahead of time, we were simply told, that's the way it is! Had we of known, we would have just waited! We couldn't just cancel then and walk in again and re-book, because they have a 72-hr cancellation policy. Then, the next surprise was a $250 security deposit - when I asked what that was about, the reponse I was given was that Key West is a party town. Now mind you, I was there on an off week when nothing was going on and I am 56 yrs old and was with my husband - and we are not exactly wild looking! And this is my 4th yr staying at different Key West inns and b&b's and have NEVER been charged a security deposit. So this created a very sour beginning - and there was really nothing after that that made me terribly thrilled about my choice of hotels - as opposed to other places I've stayed in Key West. The towels were really crappy for what this hotel is trying to be - they are no better than Motel 6 quality - thin, cheap with threads and flaws - and we only got 2 bath towels each day. The breakfast was OK - were it not for the various croissants that were obviously bakery fresh, it would have been pitiful - nothing outside the usual bread, bagels, oranges, apples, bananas and 2 kinds of cereal. The juice cups are the tiny rinse cups you are given after getting your teeth cleaned. The staff other than the gentleman who checked us in did seem very friendly and it was obvious they are working hard to keep the place spic and span - no issues there. The rooms are nicely decorated, there is ample parking and the location is good. But, there are so many great warm and fuzzy places to stay in Key West - this does not fit the bill. Try the Orchid Key around the corner on Duval instead - it's got Key West charm!

Reviews.Title: “Room doesn't have good sound proofing”
Reviews.Author: ykh
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a nite only but I didn't enjoy the stay because I couldn't sleep well. The room has poor sound proofing. You can hear the car/human traffics from the truman st even every door and window is closed. I got woked up at 2:30 a.m. because there were several people talking at the pool area. The pool area should been closed during these hours. The door in the room has such a big gap between the door and the door frame that any noise will get thru easily. You can actually see sun light pass thru this gap. For the price that I paid and couldn't get a good nite sleep, not worth it, won't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: freeezebaby
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at the beginning of November, $179 ea. night Fri/Sat and $149 ea. night Sun/Mon. The property has only been open a few weeks but everything seemed to be operating very smoothly. The rooms are nicely furnished and decorated. The accent colors of aqua/lime are carried throughout the whole property - bathroom tiles, bed pillows, pool loungers etc. Staff was very helpful with suggestions for near by restaurants, giving directions, hailing cabs, extra towels. The only thing they were not able to accommodate was a late check out on our last day but they were able to securely store our luggage and there are restrooms by the pool for changing. Continental breakfast is included daily. Delicious bakery pastries but otherwise typical but adequate continental spread: cold cereal, bagels, bread for toast, juice, milk, fruit (apples, oranges, bananas). A few comments, not necessarily negative items, but personal preferences: -there are lovely plantation shutters in the rooms, however they let in too much light for me. (I like to sleep in total darkness) -the hotel is a "green" property, and the "green" showerhead had very low water pressure. Also as a green property get rid of the styrofoam coffee cups. -the fitness "center" consists of 3 cardio machine with approximately 1 foot spacing between each machine and the walls, a little too cozy to work out comfortably. -the carport/parking area is quite large and makes the property feel like a motel from the outside, maybe when the landscaping matures this will be better. It would have been nice to dedicate some additional space to the workout and pool areas, a hot tub would have been great. All in all a very nice property in a good location!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough stay”
Reviews.Author: PK&TK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Silver Palms for three night last week. The place is new and therefore spotless which was nice. Pretty good location as long as you don't have a room facing Truman Ave. There were some wierd design issues which surprised us since it is so new--the bathroom is tiny and the bathroom door to the toilet/shower area completely blocks the sink when open, the balconies are tiny and only have one small plastic chair which is odd, and although our room was 'poolview', it actually faces the parking lot which surrounds the pool. Breakfast was fine, similar to other places. I was surprised that they asked for a $250 security deposit when we arrived--I have never had a hotel ask for that so make sure your credit card has room for it. Decor is nice although we don't particularly like the 'euro-modern' look in the Keys, pool area is pretty and the personnel were pleasant. If the prices stay low, this is a good value in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice!”
Reviews.Author: Sun-n-fun
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Silver Palms. Mike, the front desk manager, was extremely friendly and fun to talk to upon our arrival. He made sure we were introduced properly to their services. The rooms are not huge but very modern and certainly adequate. The beds ultra-comfortable! The pool atmosphere was nice but the weather didn't allow us to use it. It was about a 20 minute walk to Duval or to Mallory Square. I did have one complaint- someone who identified themselves as a housekeeping manager called at 8:30am and asked to enter our room to look for something. When I told him we were sleeping he asked when he could come in. Being a female this was kind of scary. My husband took the phone and told him the item they were looking for was not there and hung up. Strange! Besides this we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “All in all a great stay in what is a well equipped, modern hotel.”
Reviews.Author: allanhog
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel. Our room had two large and very comfy beds and the bathroom was huge! The location is a good walk from the more popular parts of Duval Street but we liked that as we could walk off the huge portions of food that we got served in the restaurants. Nice sized swimming pool - not large but great for cooling off in. The best poolside sunbeds I have ever used. The included breakfast is worth getting up for - a good selection of pastries, breads, cereals and fruit. All in all a great stay in what is a well equipped, modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, only coupons don't work”
Reviews.Author: verschuur
Reviews.Content: Pardon my englisch, I'm foreign. But I'll try... This is a very nice hotel. Large new rooms, very charming. For America the breakfast is very good. Pool area is great, poolbeds are comfortable. Only big dissapointment was the discount coupon, which did not work. They trie to get you to the hotel with a low price, but once you're there, they will nog accept it. Although we were in the low season and there was still vacancy. So you will pay the higher price anytime!

Reviews.Title: “OH!!!, what a stay it was!”
Reviews.Author: RetiredRidgecrest_CA
Reviews.Content: It was only a one night stay but OH!!!, what a stay it was. From the time our gracious hostess and manager Susan met this weary traveler with a cool bottle of water at check in, it just kept getting better and until the time of our rapid and â€œno problemâ€� check out the next day, it was glorious. I have read the previous reviews since returning home from our Florida trip and concur with all of them, even the one in French of which I understood very little but I did understand â€œfantastiqueâ€�. This facility is not a remodel, not a refurbish, not a â€œdo overâ€�. This is a newly constructed property. Ownership should be very proud. They have it all: a beautiful structure; a lovely & relaxing salt water pool; spacious, airy, comfortable, clean rooms; lovely interior and exterior. It would be a great spot for honeymooners and young lovers. . .no further comment. The staff is neat in appearance; courteous; knowledgeable; and make you feel as if you are the only guest at the resort. I really appreciated the pillow top mattress. We slept through, and missed, what I now understand to be an ample and well presented breakfast, . .possibly because we spent a late night at waterâ€™s edge over a â€˜fewâ€™ beers listening to a fantastic jazz guitarist and a well throated singer, or probably, and most likely, because that pillow top mattress was just too comfortable for us to leave. LOL All in all, a great stay for the money and, I am sure, bound to become the #1 place to stay when in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Modern design and great because it is brand new”
Reviews.Author: Pippi2
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights in end of October at a daily rate of 149 USD + tax. My room had a pool view, which is more precisely described as car park and pool view. Silver Palms is a typical inn/motel style property, but since it is brand new it is great. The color scheme is light with some nice touches of more bright colors and the design is modern. I'm not sure if all the rooms have the same set up. My bath room had a toilet and a shower with nice tiles. The sink is located in the main room. The main room has no carpet, which adds to the cleanliness feeling. Bed was comfortable. The room also has a flat screen TV, coffee maker, microwave and an empty fridge. The balcony only had one chair. Even though the balcony is small, there should be room for a second chair. The car park felt spacious and is free for guests. The breakfast is served in the same room as where the front desk is located. The breakfast area is rather small, but I took my breakfast out to the pool area or to my room. They have a selection of pastry, bread, oatmeal, fruit etc. and best of all proper dark bread. I counted 16 sun beds by the pool. It would be hard to fit any more beds into the area without making it too cramped. Pool was nice, but on the small side. However, I did enjoy some relaxing hours here every day. Cleanliness was good as far as I could tell. I'm a light sleeper, but did not have any sleeping problems during my stay. In addition to the car park/pool area my room was facing a backyard on the opposite side. Short walk to Duval St. I think Silver Palms is a great choice because it is brand new and it is in short walking distance to the attractions in Key West. Hopefully the owners and the employees manage to maintain the property in the future to keep the excellent standard it has today.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT AN AWESOME PLACE”
Reviews.Author: RKB73
Reviews.Content: You could not do better staying anywhere else in Key West. Two blocks from Duval Street, free covered parking, free continental breakfast included in the price of our room, upscale breakfast with pastries from a local bakery, a beautiful room with it's own private balcony, friendly and helpful staff and a lovely salt water pool with a waterfall. This green hotel is new and everything you would expect in a 4 star establishment. Don't miss out!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mabelita5354
Reviews.Content: First guests in this wonderfull hotel, excellent located, charming people, we recommend this place!!!!!!!!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Silver Palms Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 830 Truman Avenue, Key West, FL 33040
